intro: Verbascum lychnitis subvar. albiflorum, commonly known as the whiteflower mullein, is a perennial plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open fields. Its leaves are large, woolly, and lobed, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. It is often used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance.
